info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 7:47PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...RAIN TO CHANGE TO FREEZING RAIN THIS EVENING... Light rain will slow change to freezing rain across far southern South Carolina and into interior Southeast Georgia this evening as temperatures drop at or just below freezing. The risk for ice accumulating on trees, cars, bridges, overpasses and other cold surfaces will increase as the evening progresses. Some locations that could see freezing rain through late evening include Sylvania, Millen, Metter, Statesboro, Tarboro and Beaufort. If you observe freezing rain, please let the National Weather Service know by calling 888-383-2024 or you can email the report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for slick spots on paved surfaces. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.
